content:
Diagnosis:	Bilateral breast cancer

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Right mastectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy
		26 Jan 2024 Left mastectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	Right: Mixed ductal/mucinous carcinoma, Grade 2, pT2N0(0/3)M0
		Left: Mixed ductal/mucinous carcinoma, Grade 2, pT1cN0(0/2)M0
		Both tumours ER/PR negative, HER2 3+ positive

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 3 adjuvant TCHP chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is progressing well through her adjuvant chemotherapy regimen. She has completed two cycles of docetaxel, carboplatin, trastuzumab and pertuzumab (TCHP) with good tolerance overall. Her main side effects have been grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips, which improves between cycles. She experienced one episode of neutropenic fever after cycle 1 requiring brief admission, but subsequent primary GCSF prophylaxis has prevented further episodes.

She reports good energy levels between treatments and has maintained her usual daily activities. Her surgical sites have healed well with no complications. She describes occasional mild discomfort around the right chest wall but this is well controlled with regular paracetamol. Her appetite remains good and her weight is stable at 68kg.

On examination today, both mastectomy sites show satisfactory healing with no concerning features. There is no lymphoedema or skin changes. Cardiorespiratory examination is normal. Blood results show adequate haematological parameters for cycle 3, with stable renal and liver function. Recent echocardiogram shows preserved left ventricular function with ejection fraction of 60%.

I am happy to proceed with cycle 3 TCHP today as planned. We will arrange repeat cardiac assessment prior to cycle 4, and continue primary GCSF prophylaxis. She will be reviewed again in three weeks' time.

cancer_timeline.value: Right mastectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Left mastectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Started adjuvant TCHP (docetaxel, carboplatin, trastuzumab, pertuzumab) chemotherapy
Added primary GCSF prophylaxis after neutropenic fever with cycle 1

patient_facts.value: Mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips, improving between cycles
Occasional mild discomfort around right chest wall, controlled with paracetamol
Both mastectomy sites show satisfactory healing with no concerning features
Echocardiogram shows preserved left ventricular function with ejection fraction of 60%

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer post-mastectomy, progressing well through adjuvant TCHP chemotherapy with good tolerance after initial neutropenic fever
Grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy, previous neutropenic fever after cycle 1
Proceeding with cycle 3 TCHP with continued primary GCSF prophylaxis
Repeat cardiac assessment prior to cycle 4
